channel.title: Posts on Srini's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Srini's blog

item.title: Build companies logos as a service startup
item.description: While working on a project, I have to write a program to crawl logo images of various companies. I have automated this with puppeteer script written in Typescript/Javascript. While this script has done the job for me - extracting 100 odd companies logos, I have to warn you that I haven’t tested more than that. You can install the required packages with the following commands, npm i puppeteer puppeteer-extra-plugin-stealth --save npm i reflect-metadata node-fetch fs puppeteer-extra --save Then,

item.title: The best podcasts I listened
item.description: This post is an archive of the podcasts I have liked for the sheer brilliance of the interviewee. This post will be updated as I listen more. Note: The order of appearance does not indicate any preference. (Machine Learning Joins with Arun Kumar) [https://softwareengineeringdaily.com/2019/04/10/machine-learning-joins-with-arun-kumar/] (Cruise: Self-Driving Engineering with Mo Elshenawy) [https://softwareengineeringdaily.com/2019/10/01/cruise-self-driving-engineering-with-mo-elshenawy/] (Kubernetes Vision with Joe Beda) [https://softwareengineeringdaily.com/2019/06/11/kubernetes-vision-with-joe-beda/] (Envoy, with Matt Klein) [https://kubernetespodcast.com/episode/033-envoy/]

item.title: Using Python crontab correctly
item.description: In this post, we are going to examine how to setup python-crontab correctly and debugging for possible errors and how to resolve them. For the uninitiated, python-crontab is a python package for editing cron table aka crontab used for scheduling the jobs run by cron. I have setup a cron job which runs for an every hour. I have a file every_hour.py that contains the following code and sets up crontable entry to run cron.
